infodynamics.measures.continuous
Class MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon

java.lang.Object
  infodynamics.measures.continuous.MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChannelCalculatorCommon, ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
Direct Known Subclasses:
MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKernel
public abstract class MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
extends java.lang.Object
implements MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate

Base class for implementations of MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, e.g. kernel estimation, Kraskov style extensions. It implements some common code to be used across mutual information calculators

Author:
Joseph Lizier, joseph.lizier at gmail.com

Field Detail

dimensionsDest

protected int dimensionsDest
Number of dimenions for each of our multivariate data sets

dimensionsSource

protected int dimensionsSource

sourceObservations

protected double[][] sourceObservations
The set of source observations, retained in case the user wants to retrieve the local entropy values of these. They're held in the order in which they were supplied in the addObservations(double[][], double[][]) functions.

destObservations

protected double[][] destObservations
The set of destination observations, retained in case the user wants to retrieve the local entropy values of these. They're held in the order in which they were supplied in the addObservations(double[][], double[][]) functions.

totalObservations

protected int totalObservations
Total number of observations supplied. Only valid after finaliseAddObservations() is called.

lastAverage

protected double lastAverage
Store the last computed average

miComputed

protected boolean miComputed
Track whether we've computed the average for the supplied observations yet

debug

protected boolean debug
Whether to report debug messages or not

timeDiff

protected int timeDiff
Time difference from the source to the destination observations (i.e. destination lags the source by this time: we compute I(x_{1,n}; x_{2,n+timeDiff}) (Note that our internal sourceObservations and destObservations are adjusted so that there is no timeDiff between them).

vectorOfSourceObservations

protected java.util.Vector<double[][]> vectorOfSourceObservations
Storage for source observations for addObservsations

protected java.util.Vector<double[][]> vectorOfDestinationObservations
Storage for destination observations for addObservsations

protected boolean addedMoreThanOneObservationSet

finaliseAddObservations

public void finaliseAddObservations()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Finalise the addition of multiple observation sets. This default implementation simply puts all of the observations into the sourceObservations and destObservations arrays. Usually child implementations will override this, call this implementation to perform the common processing, then perform their own processing.

Specified by:
finaliseAddObservations in interface ChannelCalculatorCommon
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Allow child classes to throw an exception if there is an issue detected specific to that calculator.

computeSignificance

public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(int numPermutationsToCheck)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception

Compute the significance of the mutual information of the previously supplied observations. We destroy the p(x,y) correlations, while retaining the p(x), p(y) marginals, to check how significant this mutual information actually was. This is in the spirit of Chavez et al. (see below), which was performed for Transfer entropy.

We permute the source variable against the destination (though in theory this doesn't matter for this function call).

Specified by:
computeSignificance in interface ChannelCalculatorCommon
Parameters:
numPermutationsToCheck -
Returns:
the proportion of MI scores from the distribution which have higher or equal MIs to ours.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
"Chavez et. al., 'Statistical assessment of nonlinear causality: application to epileptic EEG signals', Journal of Neuroscience Methods 124 (2003) 113-128"

computeSignificance

public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(int[][] newOrderings)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception

Compute the significance of the mutual information of the previously supplied observations. We destroy the p(x,y) correlations, while retaining the p(x), p(y) marginals, to check how significant this mutual information actually was. This is in the spirit of Chavez et al. (see below), which was performed for Transfer entropy.

We provide a simple implementation which would be suitable for any child class, though the child class may prefer to make its own implementation to make class-specific optimisations. Child classes must implement Cloneable for this method to be callable for them, and indeed implement the clone() method in a way that protects their structure from alteration by surrogate data being supplied to it.

We permute the source variable against the destination to be consistent with the description in ChannelCalculatorCommon.computeSignificance(int[][]) (though in theory this doesn't matter for this function call).

Specified by:
computeSignificance in interface ChannelCalculatorCommon
Parameters:
newOrderings - the specific new orderings to use
Returns:
the proportion of MI scores from the distribution which have higher or equal MIs to ours.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
"Chavez et. al., 'Statistical assessment of nonlinear causality: application to epileptic EEG signals', Journal of Neuroscience Methods 124 (2003) 113-128"

computeAverageLocalOfObservations

public double computeAverageLocalOfObservations(int[] newOrdering)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception

Compute the mutual information if the first (source) variable were ordered as per the ordering specified in newOrdering.

We provide a simple implementation which would be suitable for any child class, though the child class may prefer to make its own implementation to make class-specific optimisations. Child classes must implement Cloneable for this method to be callable for them, and indeed implement the clone() method in a way that protects their structure from alteration by surrogate data being supplied to it.

Specified by:
computeAverageLocalOfObservations in interface MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
Parameters:
newOrdering - array of time indices with which to reorder the data
Returns:
a surrogate MI evaluated for the given ordering of the source variable
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

computeStartAndEndTimePairs

public java.util.Vector<int[]> computeStartAndEndTimePairs(boolean[] sourceValid,
                                                           boolean[] destValid)
Compute a vector of start and end pairs of time points, between which we have valid series of both source and destinations. Made public so it can be used if one wants to compute the number of observations prior to setting the observations.

Parameters:
sourceValid -
destValid -
Returns:
